text: european football's governing body uefa
has moved the venue for this year's
champions league final from saint
petersburg in russia to paris following
the invasion of ukraine let's join john
watson at the bbc sports center for more
on that john politics and sport
intertwined once again yes they are
indeed so very good morning anita we've
learned that paris as you were saying
there will stage this year's champions
league final after uefa chose to strip
russia from hosting the game on may the
28th the stad de france the replacement
stadium being used now instead of the
gazprom stadium in saint petersburg
following a meeting today of uefa's
executive committee it's the third
season in a row that the final has now
been moved ua for extending their thanks
and appreciation to the french president
emmanuel macron at a time of
unparalleled crisis they said it's also
emerged that uh russian and ukrainian
clubs competing in uefa competitions
will be required uh to play their home
matches at neutral venues now until
further notice that means that spartak
moscow the only russian club remaining
in european competition this season will
not be able to play at home in their
last 16 tie of the europa league they've
just been drawn to face the german club
rb leipzig
worth pointing out that the national
teams of russia and ukraine are both due
to play in world cup playoff matches in
a bid to try and qualify for the world
cup in qatar later this year now those
matches are due to be played in around
three weeks time russia taking on poland
on the 24th scotland host ukraine the
same day will the polish fa have said
that the match should not be played in
russia they've called for an alternative
location to be found the fifa president
gianni infantino said it would be looked
at as a matter of urgency sweden
themselves could meet russia in the
playoff final if they get there they
said that playing in russia at the
moment was unthinkable now we're
expecting a decision today on the
staging of the russian grand prix in
sochi that's in september
of course we heard from sebastian vettel
he said that it should be cancelled and
that if the race does go ahead he would
not compete
as you were saying their sport and
politics colliding we know that sport
has always been very important to
vladimir putin with the staging of the
winter olympics in sochi in 2014 and the
football world cup there four years
later but as things stand saint
petersburg stripped of the champions
league final anita but spartak moscow as
things stand still able to compete in
the europa league albeit playing their
home leg at a neutral venue
john thank you very much for that
